intro: Choricarpha, commonly known as the rockcress, is a genus of flowering plants in the mustard family (Brassicaceae). These plants are typically found in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. They are characterized by their small, often clustered flowers and linear, succulent leaves. Choricarpha species are generally perennial and can form dense mats or low shrubs. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
